perturbation.original_text: The term of this Agreement shall be effective as of the date first stated above and shall continue for a term of three (3) years, unless terminated earlier in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement (the "Term"); provided, however, that PrimeCall may elect to terminate this Agreement, upon thirty (30) days' written notice, at any time from and after the time that collectively RSL Communications, Ltd. and/or its Affiliates holds less than fifty percent (50%) of the voting control of DeltaThree's outstanding shares.
perturbation.changed_text: The term of this Agreement shall be effective as of the date first stated above and shall continue for a period of three (3) years, unless cancelled earlier in accordance with the stipulations of this Agreement (the "Term"); provided, however, that PrimeCall may choose to end this Agreement, upon sixty (60) days' written notification, at any point following the time that collectively RSL Communications, Ltd. and/or its Affiliates possesses less than fifty percent (50%) of the voting control of DeltaThree's outstanding shares.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'terminated' and 'cancelled' are used interchangeably, as are 'elect to terminate' and 'choose to end'. Similarly, the notice period changes from 'thirty (30) days' to 'sixty (60) days', creating conflicting obligations. The term 'stipulations' is also used instead of 'provisions' to refer to the same concept within the contract, leading to possible ambiguity. It also introduces the term 'possesses' when previously 'holds' was used, and 'notification' instead of 'notice'.

perturbation.original_text:
DeltaThree shall reimburse PrimeCall for all costs incurred by PrimeCall in connection with the manufacturing and printing of the Calling Cards.
         Section 3.02  [Toll-Free Access Number]. Toll-Free Access Number. PrimeCall shall procure on behalf of DeltaThree a unique toll-free "800" access number for users of the Calling Card. DeltaThree shall be responsible for all costs in connection therewith.
perturbation.changed_text:
DeltaThree will refund PrimeCall for all expenses made by PrimeCall related to producing and printing the Calling Cards.
         Section 3.02  [Toll-Free Access Number]. Toll-Free Access Number. PrimeCall shall obtain on behalf of DeltaThree an exclusive toll-free "800" access number for callers using the Calling Card. DeltaThree shall be liable for all charges associated with it.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'reimburse', 'refund', 'costs', 'expenses', 'incurred' and 'made' are used interchangeably. 'Procure' is replaced with 'obtain', 'users' with 'callers', 'responsible for all costs' with 'liable for all charges' and 'in connection therewith' with 'associated with it'. Using different words without clear definitions can lead to confusion about the exact obligations of each party. Also the word 'unique' changed to 'exclusive', further highlighting subtle differences in legal intent.

perturbation.original_text: In the event that either PrimeCall or DeltaThree materially breaches any of its duties or obligations hereunder, which breach shall not be cured within thirty (30) days after written notice is given to the breaching party specifying the breach, then either PrimeCall or DeltaThree, as the case may be, may, by giving written notice thereof to the other, terminate this Agreement as of a date specified in such notice of termination, which
perturbation.changed_text: In the event that either PrimeCall or DeltaThree significantly violates any of its responsibilities or requirements under this document, which violation is not resolved within forty-five (45) days after formal notification is delivered to the violating entity detailing the infraction, then either PrimeCall or DeltaThree, as applicable, may, by providing formal notification to the other, cancel this Agreement effective on a date stipulated in that cancellation notification, which
perturbation.explanation: Here, 'materially breaches' becomes 'significantly violates', 'duties or obligations' becomes 'responsibilities or requirements', 'breach' becomes 'violation' and 'infraction'. The cure period changes from 'thirty (30) days' to 'forty-five (45) days'. 'Written notice' changes to 'formal notification'. 'Breaching party' changes to 'violating entity', and 'terminate' is changed to 'cancel'. It is also introducing the word 'applicable' instead of 'as the case may be'. These interchangeable terms create uncertainty about the standard required to trigger termination, and creates internal contradiction.
